application_details: include allegations of misconduct during litigation
rule_applied: amendments to pleadings allowed unless prejudicial
pleadings can be struck if no reasonable cause of action
decision_reasoning: conduct does not shift burden of proof
allegations relevant only to costs inappropriate

decision_outcome: Amendments allowed in part; counterclaim remains intact

cause_of_action: Dispute over patent infringement and validity

legal_basis: Allegations of motive are only permissible if they have a patent and relevant purpose in the pleadings, particularly when connected to claims for costs.
decision_reasoning: The defendant's paragraph 8 alleged motive but lacked a clear causal link to their claim for costs. Without a counterclaim or relevance to the case, the pleading was deemed unnecessary.
procedure_followed: Motion to strike paragraph 8 was filed and reviewed by Giles, Associate Senior Prothonotary.
result_of_case: Paragraph 8 was struck out entirely; application allowed.
cause_of_action: Defendant included irrelevant motive allegations in their defense.
